2015 - 93: Most complaints by residents against the police do not result in discipline against officers.
2015 - 107: A video of a Chicago teenager who was shot by a police officer in 2014 was released more than a year later.
2015 - 124: We measured the favorite Times articles of 2015 in a new way, by the total combined time readers have spent looking at them.
2015 - 136: One woman who was assaulted by the Oklahoma City police officer, Daniel Holtzclaw, said she still lived with the trauma “day after day.”
2015 - 137: A grand jury declined on Monday to indict the police officers involved in the 2014 shooting death of 12-year-old Tamir Rice in Cleveland.
2015 - 140: Homeless encampments proliferated. Two officers, confronting armed men, were shot and killed. And many New Yorkers said they felt less safe.
2015 - 141: Protesters gathered after a judge declared a mistrial in the case of Officer William G. Porter, who was charged in the death of Freddie Gray.
2015 - 149: A New York police officer was arrested in Brooklyn this week and charged with sexually abusing the daughter of a family friend, the authorities said.
2015 - 150: It’s become a standard response to mass shootings in America: If only more “good” Americans were armed, the “bad guys” wouldn’t have a chance to kill.
2015 - 152: Mayor Rahm Emanuel, under pressure after a series of fatal police shootings, unveiled new strategies that include equipping all patrol cars with Tasers.
2015 - 162: Jenchesky Santiago, a police officer in Prince George’s County, Md., was convicted on Wednesday of first-degree assault for pointing his gun in a civilian’s face.
2015 - 163: Police officers responding to a report of a robbery in Miami Beach on Saturday fatally shot a shirtless man during a standoff that was captured on cellphone video.
